p: A. melanocarpa contains polyphenolic compounds, procyanidins and anthocyanins in its berries and bark which exert immunomodulation and anti-inflammation activity by inhibiting nitric oxide production ( 170). Reduction in blood glucose level and antioxidant properties are observed through the inhibition of alpha-glucosidase and xanthine oxidase, respectively ( 171, 172). Along with polyphenols, flavonoids such as anthocyanins, proanthocyanidins, flavanols, flavonols, cynidin-3-galactoside, and cyaniding-3-arabinoside exhibited wide range of therapeutic benefits, including gastroprotective, hepatoprotective, antiproliferative, and cardiovascular-protective properties ( 173).
